name: Colleen Wilger
text: If I could give this company a zero I would.  Please stay far away if you want an honest assessment and accountability. I will explain the events and you can judge for yourself.  The experience started off quite well, Christian was quick to come out for a consult, where he made the assessment that flying squirrels were the cause of our attic sound.  He then proceeded to hand my husband a contract for $2400 without explaining charges.  My husband questioned the cost and he quickly removed the multi year warranty which lowered the price to $1400. He was then told it would be a week before any exclusion work would be done.  He agreed and waited. The company placed barriers on roof and a one way door to allow squirrels to leave on their own (work happened on a Tuesday).  So we waited some more.  The next Monday.  A week later we were still continuing to hear the SAME noise.  I called the company (twice) before someone named Greg came out to do a check.  He only checked the roof and not the interior of the attic where the sound was, said everything looked good and was working correctly.  We voiced our concerns and he said sometimes they take 3 weeks to leave but that there is a possibility that since the excrement looks similar it could be mice instead but if that was the case it would require a different company. He said they could set traps but would just wait until the follow up the following week. Mind you the amount you pay up front is not refundable AT ALL. so that Monday night once again we hear the noise (2 weeks into the process now and the sound is right above the master bedroom so two weeks with no sleep).  The next day I go to Home Depot and get traps myself.  Place the traps after work (about 7pm) and by 10 pm the have a heart had caught something! But to our surprise.  It was not a squirrel but a mouse.  We release it the next day and reset the trap as well as two old school back cracker style traps, the next morning we’ve caught another.  Still no squirrels.  I call the company obviously irritated (once again takes two calls to get a call back). Greg calls back and is super defensive won’t admit there is a chance that they did not assess the full situation correctly (house was built in the 70’s so sure maybe there was a chance there was old poop up there from something else).  Once again extremely defensive, belittling, opposite of good customer service.  Says he is the boss there is no one above him to discuss my concerns with.  They are currently still supposed to come do a recheck and spray some sort of an enzyme mix to stop squirrels from coming back (that we’ve already paid for at this point) but if Squirrels were not the problem what good is that?? I think even an admission that the initial assessment could have been wrong would have gone a long way but no.  they basically said there is no way to prove that squirrels didn’t leave...even though the sound is still present so the situation is obviously not resolved oh and the icing on the cake, the company does not trap mice.  If your in the Vestavia, AL area please pick a different company if you don’t know for sure the specific animal you have a problem with because this company will be honest upfront.  If Christian had told my husband..look here is what I think but there is a chance 50/50, 75/25 whatever you want to call it that this won’t work to solve your problem because you may have a different problem or two problems...then we would be looking at a different review.  I’m not unreasonable I just expect accountability.  I still have a phone call in to someone at a higher level at the company hoping for some answers  or resolution before taking further action but my hopes are not high.   Best thing I can do is to warn my fellow neighbors and friends.

resp.text:
Mrs. Wilger,

We appreciate your review although there needs to be some clarification. Your attic did have signs of squirrels. We do not make guarantees that wildlife will be removed within a specific time period and your complaints about still hearing noises happened while we were not yet entirely completed with the service. Wildlife are unpredictable and one week is not enough time to know if our service is working or not. We completed all of the repairs per the schedule and we have to let our systems run their course. Thank you again for your business and we look forward to resolving your issue.

company. They damaged my celing during an inspection and still have not fixed it. They had us pay for the squirrel removal and seal and 2weeks later they still haven't shown up to do the job.

Response from the owner a day ago

Mrs. Akinsanya, The job was scheduled for 9/24/19 as agreed upon when the contract was executed. All work was completed then. As soon as we found out about the damaged ceiling, we informed you that we would get that fixed as soon as we know all of the squirrels have been removed to decrease the risk of live squirrels getting into into the living space of the house. We greatly appreciate the opportunity to serve you.

I'm sorry but you have the wrong information. When Richard came to our home on 9/6/19 to pick up the check and contract he said we would receive a call on 9/9/19 to schedule because the service had to be paid in advance before the job could be scheduled. Which we never did receive a call so my husband called on Tuesday and we were scheduled for 9/19/19 between 8-1. We tried to cancel because that seemed too far out to allow the squirrel to remain in our home to keep causing damage, but we were quickly reminded of the No Refund Policy. At 12:30 on 9/19 we received a call saying no one would be able to come do the job that day because of a delay in his schedule (eventhough we had rearranged our schedule to make sure someone would be at home) and that he had to come on Sunday morning 9/22/19.
You may want to retrain your staff to give complete information upfront   and double check your information before responding.
Thank you!

Update: It's September 2020 and they won't answer our calls and still have not fixed our ceiling!
Stay away from these scammers!

resp.text:
Mrs. Akinsanya,

The job was scheduled for 9/24/19 as agreed upon when the contract was executed. All work was completed then.

As soon as we found out about the damaged ceiling, we informed you that we would get that fixed as soon as we know all of the squirrels have been removed to decrease the risk of live squirrels getting into into the living space of the house.

We greatly appreciate the opportunity to serve you.

Thank You

name: Louise McClenndon
text: Austin was very informative about wildlife and I'm very happy with the results.

name: Geedy Dorman
text: Thought I had a issue with a rat in the wall of my home.  Called Conserve Wildlife Removal and they sent Brice McClendon out this afternoon.  Before he came I found the entry point and was able to seal it.  When Brice came out he discussed some possibilities then conducted a through inspection of the outside as well as all through the attic.  He provided recommendations for repairs and stated he would follow up in the next couple of days.  Very pleased with the service he provided and recommend him if you  believe you have issues.

name: Jane Underwood
text: We can't say enough about the great service we have received from Conserv & their technician, Bryce.  We have had an ongoing battle with squirrels.  We called Conserv & they responded very quickly & professionally.  The squirrels are quite persistent & each time I have contacted Bryce he has responded as quickly as possible & has done a great job of communicating & keeping us apprised  of what he is doing.  He is extremely professional, knowledgeable & friendly.  He is a great ambassador for the company.  Highly recommend Conserv for pest issues!

resp.text:
Mrs. Underwood, thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We greatly appreciate your business. Thank You!
Kyle Waltz, President

name: Hal McHale
text: Daxton and team executed a plan precisely to rid us of flying squirrels. Besides removing the wildlife from our attic, he was very respectful and a pleasure to work with.

name: Julie Ray
text: Got here quick and got the job done. Very professional! Thanks Christian.

name: Ludmila Williams
text: This is my first negative review and I hate having to do it but I contacted these people because of all the good reviews. I have 2 townhomes, a little Bat had started visiting one of my porches, we tried everything and the little thing kept coming back. I called Conserv and asked if they could do anything to get rid of the bat, they said they would have someone call me to come out. Daxton called and came out a few days later, my husband met him and Daxton recommend to have both homes sprayed so we did. It cost $189, which we were good with if it meant the Bat would leave. The next day a different Bat showed up so my husband called Daxton directly (which he said we could do) and he said he would come out and see. Never heard from him again. My husband and I have call every week since July 3rd and every time we get “I’ll get someone to call you back”. I was not looking for a refund AT ALL I just want the Bats gone. Ever since we had the houses sprayed we now have 2 different bats that come every night. I just wish they would be honest with me and say there is nothing they can do instead of giving me the run around. Pretty disappointed with my experience. I guess I will stop trying at this point and just count my losses.

resp.text:
Good Afternoon Mrs. Ludmila,

We really appreciate the review.

We took a deep look into our phone records and your account information and here is what we found.

Phone records show Greg did return your calls. There wasn’t a single call that went unreturned. We are not sure what the confusion was here, but am deeply sorry for any miscommunication.

Service agreements you signed indicate you purchased a one time deterrent application to the exterior of your home to deter the bat that was showing itself on the exterior. The service clarified that there is no guarantee because the bat can’t legally be relocated and we can’t control a bat flying outside or landing on your home on the outside. Because the bat was only on the outside of the house and did not enter the structure, there is nothing more that can be done to deter the bat.

We would be happy to come by to take a second look at no charge.

Thank You,

Management

name: Ryan Baldwin
text:
I contacted the company in late May to help with a squirrel issue. The Tech arrived and found the entry point that the squirrel was using to get in the attic. I was then informed that they could put up something to allow the squirrels to get out, but not get back in. I agreed to their charge of $399 to perform the service and the tech said that he would be back the following week to complete the task.

On the following Wednesday, I received a message that the tech had been let go from the company and to call the office to reschedule the appointment. I called back and they were unable to send anyone out to complete the task in a reasonable time frame, so I informed them to refund my money and I would handle the issue myself. I was informed that they could not issue a refund, so I asked to speak to a manager.

The following day, I spoke to Rick(VP of Ops) and was informed that I should have my refund in the next couple days. I checked a week later and still no refund. I then called Rick back and he apologized and told me that he would ensure the refund was made and would be in my account in the next few days. Again, no refund after a week. I then called Rick again and received no answer, so I followed up with the office(Birmingham) and was told that Rick was no longer with the company. Surprise, Surprise.

Fast forward, I've spoken to multiple people about the refund and they have sworn that I will be getting it. I hate to say that it has now been 3 months since my first scheduled appointment with this company and still nothing has been done to resolve my issue.

If I were you, I'd look for someone else to do your wildlife removal.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Update-9/9/2018

Even though the owner has commented that a refund was processed, it is over a week later and there is still no refund.

Kyle-Where is my refund?

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Update-9/13/2018

Got my refund.

resp.text:
Mr. Baldwin,

Thank you for taking the time to leave a review. We are very sorry that your experience was not pleasant. A refund has been sent for processing.

Sincerely,

Kyle Waltz, President

name: Mary Ann Meadows
text: This company practices fraud!  Don’t walk!  RUN!  They are deceptive and charge for no work.  Said my attic had bats and gables needed retired.  The honest company showed me my gables were clean and screening was in perfect condition.  This company told me they would find my check I had given the tech that didn’t show up for the work and would call me back.  Instead they cashed check for doing absolutely zero work!

resp.text:
Mrs. Meadows,

First off, I want to thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. Reviews help us improve. We looked into your situation and found the following; our former branch manager was the one who sold this work to you. At that time, he was filling in for a vacant position and was doing 2 jobs. He was very good at his job. It seems that he never scheduled for your work to be completed. We are very sorry for any inconveniences and will be happy to provide you with a refund for any in-completed work. Thank You and we are sorry for any inconveniences. As far as him charging you for things you do not need, we do not condone that type of behavior and we appreciate you bringing that to our attention. Since he is no longer an employee, we will not be addressing that with him but will certainly bring that up in our morning meeting tomorrow.

Sincerely,

Kyle Waltz, President

name: John Schueth
text: We had a family of armadillos living under our porch and Conserv trapped them all and sealed off the porch for a very reasonable price. I would highly recommend them if you need this service.

name: Kendall Henne
text: Great customer service and very professional.

name: Firas Nasr
text: I found a blind rakoon at my property so I called them to report this and hoping they could provide a help for the poor rakoon, but what the lady over the phone did is that she took my number and name and never heard from them :/ why the hell would you take my contact info and leave the poor rakoon blind and exposed to injuries or even death ? Nobody came to me or heard from them again. Don't call them they will not do any help for the poor animals.

resp.text:
Mr. Nasr,

I'm very sorry to hear about your experience. We do not handle any animal rescue, only nuisance wildlife removal. Your information was sent to an animal rescue agency for assistance and they should've contacted you. If you are ever in need of animal rescue, please contact the department of natural resources.

Thank You,

Kyle Waltz, President

name: Maranda Duchock
text:
I have read the reviews left here and am a little wary but so far pleased. Kyle came out the same day I called and helped identify entry points for mice and bats and scheduled someone to come out the next day to repair those exclusions. He was thorough, patient, and had good advice regarding our recent flea issue despite that not being within their offering. The price was a little higher than expected but seemed to cover all of our concerns. I will update with more to say when exclusions are fixed.

Update: repairs were made the day after our initial appointment, then someone came out to follow up a week or 2 after, and we've been checked in on via phone as well! Dedicated service and our concerns or additional issues were noted and covered under warranty so I feel our home is in good hands.

name: Charity Laister
text:
DONT USE THIS COMPANY! This company is a nightmare. I paid them a hefty sum up front to provide pest control and repair my home. I have waited five months with no assistance.

1. The first day of services they failed to show after making an appointment with me. I had taken a day off of work and reiterated this so they finally sent a guy named Kyle who took my payment and signed a contract with a bunch of promises they failed to fulfill.

2. Tech. Kyle scheduled a repairmen for the following week, but the tech never showed. Neither did the pest control worker.

3. I called conserv to alert them to these no shows, in response the pest control lady texted me in the middle of the week mid-day requesting to come to my house that day. (Like most ppl I couldn’t drop what i was doing).

4. The pest control worker texted me again and planned to visit the following week.

5. On the date of the visit, I again took off work, the pest control lady said she was too busy and couldn’t make it. We rescheduled.

6. On the next scheduled appointment she again couldn’t make it because she was “too busy”.

7. Finally, I put my foot down. Conserv scheduled an appointment for both workers. However, on the date of the repairmen appointment, I received a call that the repairmen stole the company truck and quit, but that they would get someone out as soon as possible.

8. Next, I received a text from the pest control lady saying she no longer worked there.

9. I eventually had someone come to the house and walk around. He promised that a repairmen would come soon.( this was in June).

10. To date (August), I have had no repairs. Mine you all of this started in March.

resp.text: Mrs. Laister, we are very sorry to hear that you have had a bad experience. I reviewed our records and found that we have been out to your home on multiple occasions to resolve your wildlife issue. I will have a manager contact you on Monday to schedule a visit and get everything resolved.

name: Megan Stones
text: I really felt like they cared about us and were willing to work with our hectic schedules for the appointments to check the traps.

name: Jamie Goolsby
text: This is a terrible company to deal with. After finding questionable issues about the  company, I cancelled my agreement before services were rendered. They refuse to refund my money.

resp.text:
Mr. Goolsby,

We are very sorry to see you’ve had a bad experience. I have forwarded your information over to billing support to assist you with getting this resolved.

Thank You

name: Melissa Mann
text: I wish I would have had the good experience that I see in the reviews. Unfortunately,I called this past Thursday, June 28th, and informed the lady over the phone that I came home to a 3-4 foot copperhead the night before that was headed towards my dogs fence ( dogs about 2 feet away from them). Panicked I called the police that night and they unfortunately pepper sprayed him or her making the snake angry... after chasing the cop, it ended up going through a vent on the side of my house. First, I was told a Kyle would contact me and three to four hours later after not hearing anything I called back and she told me a different name (cant remember the name) and she said he would contact me shortly . I never heard anything from either of them. I have been paranoid about the snake and really wanted an ease of mind to know it was removed from under my house OR to be told it was no longer there. I also told the lady that I was afraid it could have gotten through a crack under the house and went into my home. I notice that you reply to these reviews so if you look under my account from the contact it will be under Melissa Clements.

resp.text:
Mrs Clements,

We are so sorry to hear no one got back to you. I am not sure what happened. If you would like, we can arrange to come out and perform a free inspection to determine if there is any current snake activity. Please reach back out.

name: Shawn Scott
text: Great service.

name: T Roper
text: Great Company, Does very well! results tell it all!!!

name: Che' Abbott
text: We had 2 retaining walls, a porch, back patio and furniture plus another area off the patio pressure washed.  These areas looked awesome after Martez was finished.  I highly recommend his company for any pressure washing need you have.  He and his wife were so nice to work with as well!!

resp.text: Hi Ms. Fields, thanks for having us out to pressure wash your house. Please be sure to recommend us to your family and friends. We also offer gutter cleaning, roof cleaning and driveway pressure washing services.

name: Gloria Jones
text: The service rendered by Tsunami Pressure Washing company was second to none with outstanding work ethics, professionalism, and expediency. My gutters can really breathe, now! Will hire again!

name: linda mckeen
text: I am so happy with the job Martez did at my home. I was hit by the March 25th tornado and had to get a new roof and gutters. Thought I was going to have to paint the soffits. But after Martez was done doing his magic they look as good as new! Very professional and on time. I highly recommend this company and will use them again. Don't hesitate to use this company! Thank you again Martez!

name: Serenity
text: I was very pleased with the service provided. My house looks so much better. I also had the driveway, patio, and the shed in my back yard cleaned. This was a very professional process from beginning to end and I will use them again.

resp.text: Hi Serenity, thanks for choosing Tsunami to pressure wash your home, shed, patio and driveway and thank you for an excellent review. Please let us know what we can do for you in the future.

name: Maci Cobble
text: Service was awful very unprofessional when my home dried it was dirt still on my home. When I called to express my concern he cursed me out and yelled and also over talked me. Told me had to educate me like I was a child. When I asked could he comeback he told me NO!! Or give me half of my money back he refuse. Remind you he was 5hrs late from my appointment time. I refuse to use service again and do not recommend his business to anyone.

resp.text:
Hello Ms. Cobble,
Throughout our 10 years of being in business our company has always maintained a professional standard in conduct and workmanship. The interaction that you have detailed is very contrary to what our records indicate. While our technician did arrive late due to some issue with our equipment, he in fact communicated same.  At the time, you indicated that, that was in fact ok.
Whenever we engage prospective customers whether over the phone or in person we always go over their expectations i.e. what they want cleaned and how they would like to see it look. We are then able to guide their expectations based on our own expertise. In your interaction with our technician, Martez, he indicated that your home was in fact badly oxidized and that with pressure washing it may become more evident in some parts than others. He further explained that oxidation is not caused by pressure washing  but in your case it was because of aging paint.  At the end of the service, you indicated that everything was in fact 5 star quality and you did leave a 5 star review to indicate such. It is therefore, quite unsettling that weeks later, you would call making such accusations about our professionalism and conduct thus purposely defaming our company.
With that said, we cannot stand responsibility for an issue for which our workman was not culpable. We are truly sorry that we were not able to come to an amicable resolution.

name: Kyle Nichols
text: Martez and his team are professional and quick, he did a bid for me, I signed it, and they were here the next afternoon.  They were polite and courteous to my wife and let me know when they were done.  Will definitely be calling him again.

name: L Mcc
text:
Testimonial:

Tsunami pressure washing transformed my two houses from dull, almost unnoticeable dwellings, to becoming the standouts on our block. Tsunami pressure washed my brick home, the driveways, and sidewalks. Who knew that we would become two of the most beautiful homes on the block. Our houses which both sit on the corner are head turners because of Tsunami. They are now turning the heads of neighbors, visitors, and passing cars because of the clean, beautiful, and stately appearance of our properties. Tsunami is our only choice for pressure washing. Tsunami's service moved our property from diamond in the rough to two very precious jewels.The proof is in the outcome...sheer perfection. I recommend Tsunami to transform your personal residences or your investment properties. They will give your property the face-lift it deserves to sell or rent quickly, or to just personally enjoy. Thank you Tsunami for such a great job.

L. McCauley
Formidable Group LLC

text: Mr. Martez and his crew did a fantastic job on our van! It looked like a brand new car when he finished. I have use them three times and every service is top notch. Highly recommended!

They were extremely professional, polite and friendly throughout.They began by covering our pond and our fish came through unscathed. Their equipment was excellent quality and perfect for the job. Martez is very knowledgeable about the services he provides and clearly cares about his customers and their needs. We 100% recommended Tsunami.

text: Martez and his team have  always done an excellent job of detailing my vehicle and pressure washing my home. I have been using his service for years and he is highly professional and his quality of work always surpasses my expectations. I highly recommend him!

text: WARNING/BEWARE- worst experience I've ever had with a contractor. Does NOT care about customer only cares about money. His crew removed all the shingles and then said he had to put plywood down in order to install the shingles. (A large section of roof was uncovered so it isn't like he wouldn't have known something like this ahead of time). He wanted over $6k (I had it done for under $2k paying help) to do this and I had to make a decision before the next time it rained. During the whole process he wasn't helping and was down right rude in his treatment of me. After all was said and done and we were waiting on the insurance company to make the final payment, he sent my bill to collections with additional fees. Mind you the bill would have been paid in under 30 days if he didn't try to scam me out of even more money. Now, I tried to reach out because I needed to get matching shingles for a section of the roof that needs repaired and he sends me another overdue bill and lets me know he won't bother helping me because of all the hassle he had to go through to get paid and threatens me with harassment. Wow...save yourself the trouble and hire a decent human being. Posted lies about me on his response to my yelp review...shows his true colors and how he will treat you. DO NOT USE THEM

name: Shawna Smith
text: We needed an emergency repair and Kelbie Home Improvement, Inc. was able to come out and repair 2 leaks for us the same day, literally saved us from thousands of dollars in possible damage. Thanks again guys!

resp.text: Glad we could help! Thanks for the review.

name: J. Bar
text:
I’ve had Mike Kelbie put on more than a dozen roofs over the years, because his crew does a great job for a fair price.

This is a one-star review for a very important reason, however... integrity.  Mike sold me those roofs with 15-year warranties.  12 years later, when one develops a small leak, I call to ask for a repair and all of a sudden the warranties are only 3-year warranties.

Not cool, Mike.  Not cool.

If you choose to work with Kelbie Home Improvement, know one advance that you can’t count on them long term.

resp.text: Jeremy, we did multiple roofs on Hunter and if you’re having any leaks it’s probably due from wear and tear and it may need a simple repair or some preventive maintenance. If you want, I can go over and inspect the roof at no charge to see what’s going on since we did do the work back in 2007. Please give me a call.

name: Kyle Corfman
text: Inquired about gutter cleaning and power washing, got a very quick response and a quick quote from some pictures (which I found very convenient honestly). Got a couple lower quotes from other companies, but decided to follow up with Kelbie because they seemed to be quick to respond and were more local. I asked about matching the other quotes and was immediately met with hostility followed by a series of texts mocking me including a "you get what you pay for" meme as well as a threat of other companies sueing us without insurance. I was trying to stick with them because of the quick response and availability of quick service but I would not recommend this company after this experience, albeit without receiving any service from them.

resp.text: We are truly sorry that you weren't pleased with our response. There are many companies in the area that will offer much lower prices, and you truly do get what you pay for. We don't like competing with these fly by night companies, because we can't provide quality services and pay employees what they are worth AND beat these guys on price. We truly hope you found someone and have had a satisfying experience.

name: Gary Bernstein
text: Over the weekend my roof developed leaks in the bedroom.  It had been inspected recently and was perfect.  Well a tree limb fell during the storms and punctured three spots.  I contacted Kelbie by email over the weekend and then spoke to him Monday.  He got to my house in 30 minutes and then found  the limb damage in 10 minutes.  I had enough confidence in him that I paid him and went to work.  It rained horribly today and tonight.  When I got home I looked in the pots on the bed and they were bone dry.  No drops on the ceiling. It is supposed to rain like this the next few days and I have no worries now.  Exceptional response and the same for the repair.  This is the only roofer I will ever call.  Thank you.

resp.text: Thank you, Gary. We appreciate your kind words and business!

name: Nikki Jordan
text: Kelbie roofing fitted my roof replacement into their schedule when no one else could! Not only were they quick, but the work was also of high quality at a reasonable price. I also appreciate how responsive they were with all of my questions and concerns. To sum it up, great job matched by great customer service.  I will definitely consider them for future work!

resp.text: Thank you. We look forward to it.

text: I recently had to have my roof redone and with the state of the roof, it needed to be done quickly. Mike was able to provide a quick estimate in order to get the process moving quickly. I am happy that I chose to work with Kelbie Roofing for my new roof project.

name: Ashlyn
text: Mike has been an incredible resource for us! We recently moved to the area and were struggling to find good, reliable service for things around the house! text: "I needed to replace my slate roof on my townhouse and I made a phone to Kelbie Home Improvement and received a phone call back from Mike Kelbie, the owner. name: Timothy Crowther
text:
After a severe storm in which I lost over half of my flat roof I began to call several roofing contractors in attempts to get estimates. The more estimates I got the more I began to get extremely panicked. The prices that I got were unbelievable. Doing a google search I found Kelbie Roofing. After speaking with Mike he took his time and did a thorough inspection of my roof, chimney and the ceilings inside that had water damage. Mike gave me several options from a patch to a full replacement and the price was really fair and reasonable. Talking to Mike I could tell he was extremely qualified and knew exactly what he was talking about. There was no pressure he even advised if I wanted to get more estimates he would expect no less never go with just one or two estimates. Mike sat down with me and completely went through the entire process that would take place to replace the roof from start to finish.  After speaking with Mike we decided that his knowledge and courtesy was the way we wanted to go.  After signing the contract we set up a start date, the crew he sent showed up on that date on time ready to work. The crew was very courteous and professional, when they began to tear off the roof the crew made sure that my property on the side of the house where they were tossing the trash off and my wife's flower beds were protected. If I ever had a question during this process Mike and the crew never hesitated to answer the question being as this was my first time with such a large repair. The crew went above and beyond to make sure the job was completed properly and that it looked very good. From the tear off to the minor finishing touches I am completely satisfied with the job Kelbie roofing did for me and I will not hesitate to use them in the future. Thank you Mike.

Tim from Baltimore

resp.text: Thank you so much for the fantastic review. We were happy to help and glad you're fully satisfied.

name: Hailey Wade
text: Terrible service and very unorganized. I found Kelbie's after a Google search when I was looking for someone to do a gutter cleaning job on a townhouse. The reviews were all great so i gave them a call to schedule an appointment to have the job done. I left details with a receptionist and quickly got a call from someone requesting more details about the job that I needed done. I explained the situation and urgency and the guy told me they would get someone there the next day. No time frame was given so I asked to make sure that we would be home when the Kelbie's team got there. I was told I would get a call the next morning and they would give us a time frame and to please send pictures of the home and my details in a text message. Slightly unprofessional, but whatever, I went ahead and did what he asked. The next day arrives and it's 2:30pm and we have heard nothing from Kelbie. I text the guy and ask for an update wondering when we can expect them. I get told they will be there after the crew finishes another job near by. 6:00 rolls around and no one showed up. I call this morning to cancel the job and the guy who has been communicating with me the entire time has no clue what job I'm even talking about! Relying on text messages to service your customers is completely unprofessional. It doesn't help that they don't schedule anything (not even an open time frame) and then don't show up when they do finally tell you that they will be there.

resp.text: We apologize for the miscommunication. We were absolutely bombarded with gutter cleaning calls before and during storms. We do take pride in quick response and great service and are sorry we didn't live up to it for you.

text: These guys were great was able to give us what we want to at a fair price was easy to work with did a really nice job took professional pictures before and after they came highly recommended by our realtor and we will definitely use them again we needed a roof certification right away and they were able to come out and help us we ended up just doing a new roof  we was able to get what we need it done right away on short notice without any problems the very next day they came out with the crew and materials and got the job done .

Father said they have to email invoice which I never got nor a receipt from son.  Told him son took my cc number in his truck.  He said they never do that.  I said there must be a lack of communication between them then.  Father was even shocked by price quoted by son who came out.  Now he won't do the job said sounds like too much of a headache since I was concerned with my card number and said lack of communication and that I was upset they hadn't even started.  Don't trust them

name: Sarah Irvin
text:
I tried to use their services but they never were able to get me another bid. I’ve called multiple times for one so that I could have them come out and do work. If they weren’t able to do the job, an explanation was needed.  That’s what a good company, in my opinion, would do. Instead, I’ve been just waiting for an email or phone call after I’ve reached out many times.
Too bad. They seemed nice. I’ll be moving on.

resp.text: Sorry for the delay on getting the 3rd revised quote to you. I provided 1st quote to you and you requested work to be done. Once we went out there to do repairs there was more issues than we thought. I pointed out the issues to you and provided pictures and made recommendations to fix the problem. I provided you with 2nd quote to make necessary repairs. You replied back with a call asking if there was some wiggle room to bring down price for repairs. I said I would see what I can do and get back with you. During that time we had a family loss (my close cousin) passed away due to covid. We were going through a family crisis. I apologize for not getting back with you with the 3rd quote as you were asking for a better price for repairs. I called and explained the situation to you via phone call. It’s unfortunate we were not able to provide you with our services. We were in communication up until the 3rd quote you requested for a discounted price for repairs.

name: Seema Kalsi
text:
I had  gutters installed about a month ago and I had an amazing experience. When I built my house, gutters came on the front of the house and I was looking to install gutters on the rest of the house. I called around and 4 different companies came out to give us a quote but no one compared to the professionalism and helpfulness of Veronica. The quality of the gutters are really good and they were the lowest price.

Veronica came out and completed all the measurements. She gave me recommendations for the trouble spots and was extremely helpful. She had a quote back to me the same day. On the day of installation, Veronica was in constant communication with me letting me know when the guys were coming to install the gutters. Due to rain, they were a little delayed and came close to 5pm. The guys were very professional and completed the install that night (they left at 8.30pm). I had the opportunity to test out the gutters later that evening, and Veronica called to follow up the next day to make sure that I was happy with the install.

Overall, I could not be happier with the quality of the work and the professionalism of Veronica and the installers. I highly recommend this company.

text: They roofed my rental house in Talladega.  They gave a good, accurate estimate and did the job on schedule.  The work is very nice. name: Susan Brown
text: T.G. Roofing installed my metal roof when I built my house 13 years ago. SInce then I have had multiple leaks and cannot get them to return my phone calls or come out and look at it. I have hired another company after trying to get several roofers to come out because no one wants to touch someone else's work. FInally I got a highly rated company to come out and they took pictures and showed me where the metal was cut short in several places and patched, most all of the screws are halfway or more out, the edges are patched together causing leaks and overall the work after seeing pictures is very poor. What is really sad is that the original company is not willing to look or stand by their work. so after spending the money and putting a metal roof I now am going to have to replace the whole thing not to mention the wood in several places from the leak. They put screws in the flat part of the metal instead of in the ridges which means water is constantly running over them and slowly leaking into my house. I could understand the metal needing to be rescrewed but because they did not screw it on properly the first time in order for it to be correctly done it will have to be replaced. This company has been around a long time which is one of the reasons we chose to use them in the first place but apparently they have so much business they no longer care about the quality of their work. So sad that  a company would take advantage of people and their hard earned money. I would not recommend them to anyone.

name: Paula Sharp
text: My experience with TG Roofing was horrible.  We called them for two weeks to get someone out to the house to look at a possible repair on our roof.  I was told that they would call me back. NEVER HAPPENED.  And it was right before Thanksgiving.  So I let that one go.  So I called back frist thing Monday morning and got a person that actually set up an appointment and they would be out to the house on Dec 1 after 3:00 pm.   We took off work to make sure that we would be there for the rep to  stop by.  IT NEVER HAPPENED. I called the office at 338-0490 and spoke to office person and she said that she would call this person to see where he was and call me back I told her I prefered to hold.  So she called and laid the phone done (no hold) and he said that the did not have a 40 ft ladder on him and he was in Odenville.  So she said that she would call another rep and call me back.  So Charles called and said that he would be out at the house Friday at 9:30 and take a look.  Well nobody was home and we had no clue if he had some out or not.  So I called Charles this morning and asked if he came out and looked at the roof.  He said the took a ride out and then said that they were covered up and could not get to my repair.  I'm totaly blown away at this business practice and will not recommend them to anyone.  Word of mouth is costly sir!

name: Shawn Hudak
text: The Representative was very thorough in explaining to us about the gutters and how it would help. The only issue was we were told one price but going thru your bank we had to pay another price and while waiting for an answer we signed papers. When it was declined & we decided to use our bank, neither I or my husband realized the contract was never voided and re written with the original quote. The guys that came out and did the install were very nice, walked around with us, corrected areas that were not complete. I gave them the check and that’s when my husband & I realized we paid over what was quoted (original) and that we didn’t have the correct contract. It’s our fault just as much as your representatives.

resp.text: We are happy your gutters are clog free and that LeafFilter was able to help, Shawn. We apologize for any inconvenience. If we can help in any way, please call us at 800-749-4566.

name: Paul Marlow
text: I initiated the call to receive estimate.  Ryan came out and was great and presented information well and the process.  He told me step by step the process of the gutter system and how it is installed.  Installation happened very soon after.  Install personnel came and spent 3.5 hours doing the job; rather quickly in my opinion.  Part of the process was to clean out the gutters; they sure did need to be cleaned out.  The remnants of what was in the gutters was just dropped onto whatever was beneath; ground, deck, overhangs, tools, anything that was beneath the gutters.  The problem I have with that:  the mess should have been cleaned up.  Why?  Because that is what I was told; that the installation personnel would clean up the mess. THEY DIDNT DO IT!!  My gutters are pretty high, but I was able to view one gutter from my bathroom window.  There were gaps in the gutter system, and things didn’t look right.  So naturally, I freaked out and called them to voice my concerns.  They told me in a weeks time someone would be out to inspect the entire installation job to make sure everything was good to go.  Surprisingly, someone showed up next day.  They explained that they were going to inspect everything; however they could not inspect 2 out of 4 sides of my home; didn’t have 40ft ladder (not prepared).  So based off of front and back of my home, I was ensured the system was properly installed for the entire home even though only 50 percent was inspected.  The garbage from the gutters is still laying all around my house; don’t worry leaf filter, I’ll pick it up.  Additionally, I found self tap screws (1.5 inches long) that were used from the installation littered on my driveway; haven’t checked the yard yet. Don’t know the operational status of the system yet; waiting for the rains.  Bottom line, I paid top dollar for the system but don’t feel like I received top service.  Hope the system works out as stated.

resp.text: I am sorry to hear about this experience, Paul. We are happy to speak with you more regarding this. Please give us a call at 800-749-4566.

name: Andy Hawkins
text: Installer came alone and took 2 days on a regular size house.  Did not clean up after himself

name: Wes Kaigler
text: Multiple times I've had to have someone come out to "fix" the mesh popping out, the original system was installed at night with headlamps by contractors who insisted this would not affect the quality of the system (obviously they only get paid if/when the job is completed). I called to have issues from install fixed and the next contractor showed up to my house high on something and fell in my yard, smashed one of my gutters and then proceeded to try and sell me car washes - WTH. As of recently someone who was on W2 with the company came out to fix the issues but said that to "rescreen" the gutters would cost about $300 - meaning I'm paying for the issues that came from buying this system. I advise against this system and would spend your money elsewhere. The system cost $4,400 on my house so these headaches probably shouldn't be part of a "premium" product...

resp.text: Hi Wes, we're concerned to hear about your experience with LeafFilter. We'd like to get our support team involved right away! Please visit https://www.leaffilter.com/contact/, where you can submit a service request at the bottom of the page, and someone will contact you shortly.

name: David Koonce
text: If you are reading reviews on this company to see if you want to do business with them, my recommendation is don’t do it.  The sales rep came into my home and fed us with misinformation about the product. Once we paid  him, he was gone in the wind.  He never came back to walk us through an inspection of the house. He assured us that pine straw would not pile up on top of our gutters but if it did for any reason they would come back and remove it.  Well, 3 years into this deal I have had to contact them several times about pine straw piling up. Each time, I talk with a condescending project manager who tells me I don’t know what I’m talking about and says I will be charged $100 for a service call. One guy told me if I go leave a good review, he would wave the fee.   Tonight I called the customer service number and asked direct questions about the pine straw and they assured me on the phone that it would now pile up and...you guessed it, if it did they would come remove it at no cost.  I felt like I have been lied to by several people at LeafFilter.  Save your $4000 by moving on. It isn’t worth the headache.

resp.text: Hi David, we're concerned to hear about your experience with LeafFilter. We'd like to get our support team involved right away! Please visit https://www.leaffilter.com/contact/, where you can submit a service request at the bottom of the page, and someone will contact you shortly.

name: Hannah Bradley
text:
I was looking for a maintenance free system for my home. I live under 16 pine trees and am not able to clean my gutters myself. After my research I decided to have Leaf Filter come out. I was very impressed with the product and the salesperson was very knowledgeable. They installed my system the next day and I absolutely love it. It is exactly what I was looking for. The pine needles do not clog my gutters and the rain water goes where it’s supposed to go.

I was surprised to see some of the other reviews on here. Every aspect of my experience so far has been top notch. I had a minor issue about a week after the installation (a leaking corner) and they were out within the week to fix the problem.

I highly recommend this company. If they can keep the pine needles out of my gutters, it’s a great product.

I told him there was no reason to call me to just show up and fix it. Apparently once it’s installed they don’t care. They have your money already.

My LeafFilter Gutter Protection System works flawlessly. All my trees shedded and no tome wasted climbing the roof and cleaning clogged gutters. Debris free. The spring rains have started and I have free flowing gutters. One of the best home improvement investments I’ve ever made.

Review update since July 20. I can now speak to the efficiency of the Leaffilter syybecause we’ve had several significant rain storms since my installation. As I expected the true test is November through January when the sumac leaves fall. The purchase experience was quite pleasant. The cost came in under my estimate. The representative was very professional, courteous and pleasant. The installation was quick and cleaned up as promised. The installation crew was professional, courteous and efficient. Now it’s mid December and the Leaffilter system works flawlessly. All of my leaves are off the trees. All of my gutters are spotless and free flowing. I’m extremely pleased with my purchase. Well done.

text:

A really nice man too I got know well as I was out there with him showing me what was wrong and needed. So where would I be now without Travis. Another person or new gutters? First day he came I was horrified what he found. Asked him do I just need new gutters again, was worried then about the whole house. He said no, he was repairing them, I needed to see what was wrong, those areas. Travis saved me a lot money and stress I have been through with the thought of new gutters and couldn’t be repaired. I will always use him.
I see now here too maybe he can clean them. Had no
Idea all the other things this company can do. Will be helpful for me too. All the great reviews and I have just gotten one of them, Travis. Must be just like him.

text: Hired BFP to install screens for my existing back porch. Blake contacted me the day after I submitted my request to talk through it. We ran into problems sourcing the materials (very high demand!), but he kept me informed of the delay along the way and was able to begin work as soon as we had what we needed. Work was performed over a 3 day period, and Blake showed up on time and worked diligently each day. He kept me updated on his progress during the day and the end product turned out great. text: It took about a month for someone to come out to do measurements (started the 2nd week of March). I was told I would be contacted 2 weeks later for an install. I'm not sure what its like in this line of work, but I was willing to spend close to $3K on the project and not a peep from anyone. This may not seem like a lot of money in this line of work, but $3K for a day or two of work I would be running to complete this job. I'm  concerned about the lack of follow-thru in communication. There are plenty of people that need work and it's disappointing to see the lack of interest.

text: Super salesman, he gained my trust and business pretty quickly. We were approved same day. Work was done the next day. Great work. The crew was nice, courteous and kind. They worked fastidious and meticulously. I would recommend HomeCraft to family and friends. No more paying 100s of bucks to have someone come and clean out the gutters. Thank you HomeCraft!

name: Alex Williams
text:
Ricardo showed up in Durham, NC on time to perform the free inspection and provide an estimate. Ricardo was able to present the display book and explain the benefits of their product compared to competitors.  He was able to measure the length of each gutter and provide an estimate which we were able to negotiate on after expressing concerns on the overall cost.  I was appreciative of the quick response by the add services to schedule the home inspection/estimate and am considering HomeCraft as a finalist to cover my gutters.  The quality of their diamond pattern is visibly superior to the selection that can be found at large home service warehouse stores. The superior design does have a patent on it which adds to the higher price range for the product+service installation.

HomeCraft inspector mentioned that they would install extra support braces inside the gutter every 12 inches. My gutter currently has a metal brace about every 24 inches. The front of the metal mesh design is screwed into the front of your gutters and the back end is slipped up under the first row of shingles with a weighted metal strip to secure it in place. They do not screw the product into the roof or side of your house since that usually voids a roof warranty, something they point out when displaying a sample of the product.

The product is at a higher price than what I was expecting but the company does provide some options to adjust the cost when the home inspector is present.

Again this is a product I feel like I may commit to after receiving additional quotes from competitors.

resp.text: We are so happy to hear that you had a wonderful experience with one of our representatives. Welcome to the HomeCraft Family!

name: Kim Arrington
text: My husband and I hired this company to put gutters on our home. However they did not have enough material to complete the job and said that they would be back on the following Monday to put the final gutter spout on the house. This was April 13, 2021 it is now June 5, 2021 and I have contacted the company multiple times to resolve this issue however, they still have not resolved the issue of the final downspout being placed on my home. We have spoken to several different representatives for the company with two of them telling us that the down spout would be placed on a specific date however as of this date the down spout  has not been  placed on our home. I’ve called and left multiple messages and no one has returned my call. The job was paid in full on the date of service trusting that the company would come and complete the job on the following week they said they would.

name: Katherine Boyer
text:
Chad was right on time and worked quickly. He presented a range of options and helped us pick the ones that best fit our needs. We're working on scheduling installation. EDIT AFTER GOOGLE ALERTED ME PEOPLE ARE READING THIS REVIEW: Although Chad was very polite in our first meeting, I later reflected on the experience of what turned out to be more a sales pitch than a free estimate. The price quoted at the meeting was around $7k for approx. 100 feet of gutters, brought down closer to $4k after "discounts" for posting a positive review online, for allowing the company to place signs in our yard, and for signing a contract within about an hour of meeting the company's representative. I signed the contract when my husband wasn't home (unwise, I know) and was told I had "plenty of time" to confer with him. After reading the fine print on the contract, though, I learned I had 3 business days to cancel the contract or we would owe a substantial portion of the quoted price (25%, I believe) to the company, whether or not work on the gutters was completed. I texted the company's representative that my husband and I weren't sure we wanted to go through with the project. He did text me back quickly. But he continued to follow up with several messages until rather late at night on a holiday, insisting that I needed this product to "protect the investment" in my home. Although he knew I was considering canceling the contract, a truck loaded with materials still showed up at our house while we weren't home, ready to unload. I ended up canceling the contract in writing within the 3 business days allotted, and I was able to find another company who did work we're happy with for a much lower price.

tl;dr - If you have a lot of money and want good, expensive gutters installed before you have a chance to doubt your decision, this is the company for you.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your review!

I am so impressed with HomeCraft Protection with both the company's products and their representatives.  Moriah Harrod, the Regional Marketing Manager, arrived at my home on time, prepared, and extremely informed about not only their product line but gutter systems in general. She took her time and explained every aspect of what was currently going on with my home and what could happen if I waited to make the upgrades. I am so happy I saw the advertisement on Facebook and proud to have their company sign in my yard!
Color me IMPRESSED!

name: Steph Strickland
text: We found Homecraft Gutter on Facebook while my husband and I were under contract on our new home. Once we closed, we called Homecraft Gutter and scheduled an appointment. In less than 24 hours, we had a representative out at our home. We were expecting a quick walk through and a quote within a few days. To our surprise, Victoria showed up ready to walk our property and informed us of the product and services offered. To be honest, I didn’t have the slightest clue about anything gutter related, but by the end of our conversation I felt more knowledgeable about the importance of gutters, the various types of gutter protection and why Homecraft is the best. It’s also worth noting that Victoria didn’t discount other competitors, but simply told us why Homecraft is the better option. By the end of our appointment, we were ready to become apart of the Homecraft Gutter family!

text:
We had gutters installed recently and because of the recent rains, we can  say they perform perfectly.
I was very impressed from the beginning by the wonderful communication, and the team was so courteous and installed the gutters so quickly.
The price was exactly what we were quoted, too.
Great company - highly recommend!

name: Jay Rinehart
text:
Mark was so easy to work with by emails and responded quickly to my texts.
I recommend Mark and his team they are the best and most respectful guys you could ask to be in your home!
The painters done a fabulous job along with the living room carpet and tile backsplash in my kitchen.

name: Mary Macdaniel
text:
Our service experience with all around the house was the Best we’ve Ever experienced from a remodeler/contractor, From the first apt/consult with Mark to the last bit of finishing/touch ups. Everything was perfectly addressed along the way!
They painted the outside of our house and replaced rotten siding.

name: JIMMY DEAN
text: If you have needs from gutters, roofing, flooring etc you definitely need to contact Mark with "All Around the House." He will come and give you an estimate which can't be beat for the quality of work they provide. They work with your schedule, work in a timely manner, strive for perfection and stay in contact to make sure you are pleased. I will definitely be using them again for future work.

name: Katherin Watkins
text:
Mark was very precise and knowledgeable of our roofing and gutter issues. The guys done a magnificent job, where polite and professional!
I will definitely use your services again.

name: Danielle Fife
text:
All around the house did a outstanding job on our gutters and downspouts they look flawless!
Mark arrived to give the estimate and it was dry that day but he was on point as he explained where we would an could have water troubles with draining issues by the layout of the landscape an he was on point as we’ve seen the same issues on rainy days.
The crew he sent was a pleasure to work with, hardly even knew they was outside.

name: Jacob (Jake) Wilson
text: Quality service! We needed gutters on the back side of our house and reviews were good for All Around The House, so we decided to contact for an estimate. Mark came out while we were away and gave us an accurate estimate for lower than we were thinking, so we booked a time for him to come out and install. We only needed a small amount of gutters, but Mark and his team came out and completed the job within a couple of hours with no problem. We will definitely be using them again for any more house projects!

name: Pam Jones
text: I cannot say enough good things about All Around The House. I was in need of someone to assemble two pieces of furniture and did an internet search to find someone in my area. I found All About The House, left a voice mail, and within minutes Stephen returned my call. Luck was on my side as he had some time that same day to help me out. He and Kayla arrived on time, and they quickly got to work assembling the furniture. They worked fast but did a very thorough job, even disposing of the boxes and trash after completion. They were friendly, capable, and the price was very fair and reasonable. You never know what you are going to get when you blindly reach out to someone, and I could not be more pleased with my experience with All Around The House. I highly recommend them for your home needs!

name: Paul Fife
text: They did a beautiful job with my house I had them paint inside and outside I will have them come back and do more work for me very soon

name: Julie Evelsizer
text: They were very responsive. They gave me a similar estimate to another company, who never bothered to come back, but with a lot more work for the same price. The crew was quick, neat, and professional. I had them screen in a small patio and paint the walls, and it looks wonderful.

text: I would highly recommend All Around the House and Mark. They were incredibly responsive, professional, and completed our project in a timely manner!

name: Mike & Stephanie Freeman
text:
We first called the company “Critter Capture” and had them come out to get rid of a squirrel that had made his nest in our gutter. After checking our attic and seeing that the squirrel had not yet made an entrance into our house, they told us there was nothing they could do.  The guy didn’t even have a ladder to check our gutters!

So we call Jim from Exclusive Wildlife & Pest Control.  He laughed when I told him the previous encounter with the Critter Capture company and then proceeded to get his ladder (that he brought himself!) and take a look at our gutters and ensure that the squirrel had not damaged our roof yet and also took the time to double check our attic. No damage was noted except for the fire pit cover we caught the squirrel tearing up the previous weekend.

Jim gave me two options on how to get rid of our furry new houseguest; we could capture him alive and release him elsewhere or set a trap similar to a rat trap that should kill him instantly. After much discussion my husband and I decided on the rat trap since the evenings here have been very cold and the poor squirrel may freeze to death in a live trap. Jim was so very patient as we weighed our options and was able to give me the pros and cons on both methods.

After one failed attempt to trap him (the trap caught his tail instead of his neck) Jim text me throughout the evening to reassure me that he would get him the next day and that all would be OK. Jim returned promptly the next morning, set the trap again and was able to get the squirrel instantly. He disposed of everything and cleaned the nest out of the gutter.

Jim was so very pleasant to work with I will definitely be calling again if any other squirrel decides to make his home here!
I would recommend Jim and Exclusive Wildlife to anyone who is looking for good, quality, and prompt service.

Thank you Jim!

resp.text: Thank you Mike & Stephanie Freeman, it was my pleasure helping you rid your home of your unwelcomed guest and it was nice meeting you.

text: We have had problems with our gutters since the first day we moved into our house two years ago. We finally broke down and called Absolute Guttering to take a look. Wes was friendly and explained everything thoroughly about the types of materials they offered as well as color options. He was also spot on with his explanation of how he would tie the gutters together and where the downspouts would be. He also made sure all of the downspouts were installed so they would drain into our water mitigation system. Wes runs a great company and I would recommend him to anyone! text: Moved to a new house so wanted to leave another review. You should give them a try! Having new sod our yard looked horrible. They keep track of all  treatments and payments online. When we had a misunderstanding the receptionist was so pleasant we were able to resolve the issue, and I discovered that I was wrong, but her customer service was so exceptional that I feel comfortable to call them with questions. Great company👍👍

name: Betsy Gifford
text:
Do not waste your time or money here.  This review is coming at the end of the only season where I used Superior. Throughout the year I wasn't impressed with the invasive weeds that continued to sprawl in the back yard. Normally I was not home when the service was rendered, but one time I stop the person doing the application. He was rather dismissive and said they would get taken care in the future weed control applications. I am not a professional lawn person(hence the reason I pay them)so I had to assume he was telling the truth.

Today, I was home when he came to do the final application. The truck was out front for less than 10 minutes. I have a reasonable sized lawn, front and back and a very difficult gate latch to contend with. There is a zero percent chance that he would have been able to disembark the truck, prep his application material, mange the gate, do a proper back yard treatment, latch the finicky gate latch, do the front and tag my door in that amount of time.  Suddenly then it clicked, this is likely why the back looks terrible - other than the one time I was here with the gate open, the work has never actually been done. (Included below crab grass photos taken today - after $432 in applications you should not see an increase in the amount of weeds - these patches are 2x what they were in the spring.)

It is evident that Superior does not instill in their employees a sense of pride in their work. I've had the same person so all the applications and a reputable business would develop a culture of doing the right thing. The application person should be invested enough to actually correct the problems a customer and ask for support if needed. Clearly this is not the case with Superior. The operations manager had the approach of blaming me for not bringing it to their attention at an earlier time and after consideration, I believe he couldn't be more wrong. If the applications aren't effective, his employee should be responsible and proactive enough to address this internally and find a solution for the customer.  Obviously these are not priorities for their organization.

Caveat emptor.

name: Pat B
text: Wasnt impressed with their cookie cutter maintenance schedule. More and more weeds kept growing and when calling they said they would take care of them the next round, yet as they came and treated no weeds ever died. Not sure what they sprayed but it sure didnt work. Switched lawn care companies and after first treatment 90% of weeds are gone!

name: Charlie Edwards
text: This was my 4th lawn care business. I was clear when I hired this business if you do not do a good job I will terminte my service. Second month of servicing was put off for 7 weeks. 3rd treatment was put off because I was told they didn't have the products they had to order them. Although I was assured previously of date 3rd treatment would occur. On 3rd treatment date when I was informed they wouldn't be coming on the date scheduled, they were terminated, as I told them I would not hesitate to do. I've had to dig weeds out of my lawn anyway,  they weren't doing a good job at arriving at scheduled times, not removing the weeds. I've purchased my own supplies and will treat my own lawn on my own time and not wait for no show lawn tech and managled service appointments. By the wAy it's less expensive to just buy your own supplies

I used Wayne's Environmental before I moved here...I wasn't aware until today that they have an office in the Huntsville area! I will definitely be giving Wayne's a call this afternoon!

name: Angelica -Angel- Elizabeth
text: We had bald spots and weeds that another company that we had for over a year didn't fix. We get Superior Lawn for about a year and our yard has done a complete 180. I'm really not sure why all the negative reviews, but our yard has never looked better.

name: Katie P
text: Terrible service. Do not waste your time and money with them!!!  Missed areas; one side of the yard didn’t even get sprayed on several occasions. The final time was last Friday. A pre-emergent and a post-emergent were used. We have some small Japanese cedars that we planted this year that we’ve babied all summer. We noticed on Tuesday that the lower third to lower half of 4 out of 5 trees was brown. All summer these trees were green and showing new growth. I spoke with Brandon, who didn’t know what was in the post-emergent, about it. He saw pictures of the trees and said he thought it was due to drought. We have tended to these trees all summer.  It just so happens to turn brown a few days after they spray?!  I cancelled our service. They didn’t even offer to make amends.

text:

So I called them and asked them to pls burn the entire yard, so we can plant fresh new grass... well she said they will send someone to spray the  weeds wherever needed😥
